content: Mystery flas was traced to Russian space junk. The mysterious boom and flash of light seen over parts of Virginia Sunday night were not caused by a meteor, but rather by exploding space junk from the second stage of a Russian Soyuz rocket falling back to Earth, according to a spokesman for the U.S. Naval Observatory. "I'm pretty convinced that what these folks saw was the second stage of the Soyuz rocket that launched the crew up to the space station," said Geoff Chester of the Naval Observatory in Washington. Rest here: "http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29958635/?GT1=43001" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: So, who exactly do you call when you see little green men? Is there a hotline or something? Shouldn't clog up 911 lines unless said little green man is trying to assault you, the way I figure it. You see weird stuff if you stare at the night skies enough. I saw a meteor come in so low and fast it left a smoke trail behind it, and I could almost hear it. Not exactly, I just felt the pressure of it passing. Maybe that was space debris, maybe a meteor. I dunno. It was kind of glowing, not real noticeable though. I've also seen aircraft turning at right angles in the sky. It was the Y2K New Year, nothing else was up up because everyone was so freaked out about that. It was in Iowa, on the flight path to the Omaha air base, so I figure those were Harriers or some other Air Force experimental toys. Not little green men.
reply: So, who exactly do you call when you see little green men? Is there a hotline or something?
